entry.title: The Forest Reproductive Material (Great Britain) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations implement in Great Britain Council Directive 1999/105/EC of 22nd December 1999 on the marketing of forest reproductive material (OJ L.11, 15.1.2000, p.17). The Directive replaces Directive 66/404/EEC on the marketing of forest reproductive material and Council Directive 71/161/EEC on external quality standards for forest reproductive material marketed within the Community. The Regulations replace the Forest Reproductive Material Regulations 1977 (S.I 1977/891) (“the 1977 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Public Service Vehicles Accessibility (Amendment) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Public Service Vehicles Accessibility Regulations 2000. Their main effect is to put back the date on which the requirements of paragraph 5(3)(b) to (e) of Schedule 1 (boarding ramps) come into effect from 1st January 2003 to 1st January 2004. They also increase the angle of slope of a fitted wheelchair ramp to a maximum of 8°.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (NHS Charges) Amendment (No. 2) Regulations 2002

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Road Traffic (NHS Charges) Regulations 1999 (“the principal Regulations”) which provide for a scheme for the recovery from insurers and certain other persons of charges in connection with the treatment of road traffic casualties by the National Health Service (NHS).

entry.title: The Road User Charging (Enforcement of Charging Scheme Penalty Charges) (England and Wales) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations relate to road user charging schemes in areas of England and Wales under Part III of the Transport Act 2000. They provide that, in respect of charging schemes specified in the Schedule to the Regulations, any charging scheme penalty charges payable to a charging authority under a road user charging scheme shall, if a county court so orders, be recoverable by the charging authority, as if they were payable under a county court order. The Schedule specifies the County Council of Durham (Market Place leading to Saddler Street, Durham City) (Road User Charging Scheme) Order 2002.

entry.title: The Legal Aid in Criminal Proceedings (Costs) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Legal Aid in Criminal Proceedings (Costs) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1992 so as to alter the date after which certain work may be remunerated at discretionary instead of prescribed rates from 31st December 2002 to 31st December 2003.

entry.title: Fisheries (Amendment No. 3) Byelaws (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: These Byelaws amend the Fisheries Byelaws (Northern Ireland) 1997 (“the principal Byelaws”).

entry.title: Fisheries (Tagging and Logbook) (Amendment) Byelaws (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: These Byelaws amend the Fisheries (Tagging and Logbook) Byelaws (Northern Ireland) 2001 by–

entry.title: The Waste Incineration (England and Wales) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 2 of the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999 (1999 c. 24). They partly implement in England and Wales the provisions of European Parliament and Council Directive 2000/76/EC on the incineration of waste (the Directive). The Secretary of State’s proposed Directions to transpose the remaining provisions of the Directive were set out in the Consultation Paper on implementation of Council Directive 200/76/EC on the incineration of waste.

title.div: The County of Ceredigion (Electoral Changes) Order 2002 / Gorchymyn Sir Ceredigion (Newidiadau Etholiadol) 2002

div.p: The Local Government Boundary Commission for Wales was required by section 64(1) of the Local Government Act 1972 (as substituted by the Local Government (Wales) Act 1994) to review electoral arrangements as soon as practicable after the first elections to unitary authorities in May 1995.

O dan adran 64(1) o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 1972 (fel y'i hamnewidiwyd gan Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol (Cymru) 1994) yr oedd yn ofynnol i Gomisiwn Ffiniau Llywodraeth Leol Cymru adolygu'r trefniadau etholiadol cyn gynted ag y byddai'n ymarferol ar ôl yr etholiadau cyntaf i'r awdurdodau unedol ym Mai 1995.

entry.title: The Education (Funding for Teacher Training) Designation (No. 3) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order, which comes into force on 1st January 2003, is made under section 4(2) of the Education Act 1994. It designates Encompass Education Limited, a company limited by shares having the registration number 4471179 as an institution eligible for funding under Part I of the Education Act 1994.

entry.title: The Severn Bridges Tolls Order 2002
entry.summary: Section 9(2)(b) of the Severn Bridges Act 1992 (“the Act”) provides for the tolls for the use of the bridges to be fixed by annual orders made in December of each year. This Order fixes the tolls payable for use of the Severn Bridge and the Second Severn Crossing during the year 2003.

entry.title: The District of Epping Forest (Electoral Changes)(Amendment) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order amends Schedule 2 of the District of Epping Forest (Electoral Changes) Order 2001 in relation to the order of retirement of councillors in the district ward of Roydon, so as to provide for the councillor to retire in 2003 rather than 2004.

entry.title: Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Revocation) Order (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: This Order revokes the Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2002 which contains emergency prohibitions restricting various activities in order to prevent human consumption of scallops or food which is derived from scallops originating in that part of ICES (International Council for the Exploration of the Sea) Area VIIA which is within British fishery limits and which is adjacent to Northern Ireland.

entry.title: The Occupational Pensions (Revaluation) Order (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: This Order, which corresponds to an Order (S.I. 2002/2951) made by the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions under paragraph 2(1) of Schedule 3 to the Pension Schemes Act 1993, specifies appropriate revaluation percentages. The percentages specified are relevant to the revaluation of benefits under occupational pension schemes, as required by section 80 of, and Schedule 2 to, the Pension Schemes (Northern Ireland) Act 1993.

entry.title: The Education (Bursaries for School Teacher Training) (England) (Revocation) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the Education (Bursaries for School Teacher Training) (England) Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/509), the Education (Bursaries for School Teacher Training) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/756) and the Education (Bursaries for School Teacher Training) (England) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/1137) (regulation 2(1)). However, they remain in force in relation to bursaries and grants in respect of approved training in which a qualified teacher or classroom assistant began to participate or committed himself to participate before 5th January 2003 (regulation 2(2)).

entry.title: The District of Waveney (Electoral Changes) (Amendment) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order amends the District of Waveney (Electoral Changes) Order 2001 by providing for the parish of Wangford with Henham to hold elections in 2003 rather than in 2002.

entry.title: The Crown Court (Amendment) (No. 2) Rules 2002

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Crown Court Pules 1982 in consequence of the enactment of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002. Chapter 3 of Part 5 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 permits the search for, and seizure, detention and forfeiture of, cash derived from, or intended for use in, unlawful conduct. Section 299 of that Act provides for an appeal to the Crown Court by any party to proceedings in which an order is made by a magistrates' court for the forfeiture of cash.

entry.title: The Borough of Burnley (Electoral Changes) (Amendment) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order amends the Borough of Burnley (Electoral Changes) Order 2001 by inserting necessary provision for the years of retirement of borough councillors, which had been omitted from that Order.

entry.title: The Borough of Redditch (Electoral Changes) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to recommendations by the Boundary Committee for England, a committee of the Electoral Commission, for electoral changes in the borough of Redditch.

entry.title: The Borough of Crawley (Electoral Changes) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to recommendations by the Boundary Committee for England, a committee of the Electoral Commission, for electoral changes in the borough of Crawley. The changes have effect in relation to local government elections to be held on and after 6th May 2004.
